meanings.definition: Driftiest (adjective): most prone to drifting or wandering aimlessly
meanings.sent1: She is the driftiest person I know, always getting lost in her thoughts.
meanings.sent2: The clouds in the sky moved in the driftiest way, slowly and without direction.
meanings.sent3: The cat was the driftiest member of the household, often wandering off on its own adventures.
meanings.sent4: His mind was like the driftiest river, flowing freely without a set course.
meanings.sent5: The old boat rocked in the driftiest manner, swaying gently with the current.

meanings.definition: Driftiest (adverb): in the manner that is most prone to drifting or wandering aimlessly
meanings.sent1: She walked driftiest through the park, taking in the sights without a care.
meanings.sent2: The leaves fell driftiest from the tree, dancing in the wind as they descended.
meanings.sent3: The children played driftiest in the playground, running around with boundless energy.
meanings.sent4: The music played driftiest in the background, creating a dreamy atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The clouds moved driftiest across the sky, painting a picture of tranquility.
